column1: Part of Oder Number is Replaced by

column1: Fill in this bank the content that you want to replace with the content in Replace Part of Order Number.
column2: Fill in this bank the content that you want to replace with the content in Replace Part of Order Number.

column1: You can not replace variables. If format of order number is ORD-{count}-{mm}{dd}, you only can replace ORD- part.
column2: You can not replace variables. If format of order number is ORD-{count}-{mm}{dd}, you only can replace ORD- part.

column1: Decide to use the order number as the shipment number or not.
column2: Decide to use the order number as the shipment number or not.

column1:
If the last counter number is 005 and you fill in this field number “4”, the next counter number will be 009.
Note: You should reset counter after setting new increments.
column2:
If the last counter number is 005 and you fill in this field number “4”, the next counter number will be 009.
Note: You should reset counter after setting new increments.

column1: Total number of digits of the {counter} variable. If you set this field is 4 and the counter is 23, the counter number displayed will be 0023.
column2: Total number of digits of the {counter} variable. If you set this field is 4 and the counter is 23, the counter number displayed will be 0023.

column1: Choose “Yes” to count independently for each store view.
column2: Choose “Yes” to count independently for each store view.

column1: If format of order number is ORD-{count}-{mm}{dd}, you only can replace ORD- part.
column2: If format of order number is ORD-{count}-{mm}{dd}, you only can replace ORD- part.
